description: The yen, after a very brief show of strength, fell on March 19 against the S’pore dollar to a record low of 112.148 yen. Read more at straitstimes.com.
title: Japan’s first rate hike in 17 years unlikely to dent Singdollar’s strength against yen anytime soon
title_page: Japan’s first rate hike in 17 years unlikely to dent Singdollar’s strength against yen anytime soon | The Straits Times
maintext:
SINGAPORE - Singaporeans can continue to enjoy affordable holidays in Japan backed by the record-high strength of their currency against the Japanese yen, even after the Bank of Japan (BOJ) raised its key interest rate for the first time in 17 years on March 19.
The BOJ set a new policy rate range of between 0 and 0.1 per cent, up from minus 0.1 per cent.
